name: Premodern World Literatures
description: This course approaches the premodern period by examining early British literatures alongside literary works of the period c.500-1650 from the continents of Asia, Africa, Europe, and the Americas. Texts may include Tang dynasty poetry, theÿTale of Genji, the Persian epicÿShahnameh, the ItalianÿDecameron,ÿ1001 Nights, Old Norse sagas, Chaucer'sÿCanterbury Tales, and Harriot'sÿBriefe and True Report of the New Found Land of Virginia. Texts will be provided in translation where necessary. [36L]
prerequisites: 1.0 credit in ENG and 3.0 additional credits.
